creator: seanhodgins
title: WIND - Project Accelerator for the Adafruit Feather
description: The WIND project accelerator is designed to eliminate the need for a breadboard when working with Adafruit Feather microcontrollers. It provides easy access to a mount for an 18650 battery and buttons, simplifying prototyping and deployment of projects using Feather boards.
steps: Watch the provided video for a visual guide.
Gather all the necessary parts and tools, referring to the PCB files for the BOM to ensure correct part numbers.
Start 3D printing the housing for the project accelerator, modifying the design as needed.
Solder the components onto the PCB, starting with the smallest components and working towards the larger ones. Solder all headers to the PCB.
Install threaded inserts into the 3D printed housing (if using the version that requires them).
Load the desired firmware onto the Adafruit Feather board.
Mount the assembled board inside the 3D printed housing using screws.
Deploy the project by mounting the feather and battery in the desired location to create wireless sensors, a WiFi hotspot, a sensor node, a weather station, or any other application.
Consider supporting the project's creator through Patreon or by subscribing to their YouTube channel.
